annotation.TEXT: Hello, and welcome back to Miracle Fly! Here are the voting results this time: 1 vote for a big combo in 6-5 with Mira, 2 votes for Paintball Maid Mira, 1 vote for 6-7, and 6 votes for 6-6!
Now, unfortunately, the wind has blown that gray block in the way, so I have to go all the way back to the left and change the wind again before I can get that gem.
Alright, this spot can be tricky. Try to avoid the spiky blocks, and especially don't get crushed between them and another wall, which is instant death, of course.
Also, we have a new enemy here, the ice bat. It'll chase you when you get close, and when you destroy it...
Oh, and there's a gem above the exit. I'll be getting that later.
"Tick." Graze +1.
Okay, with everything out of the way (except for the aforementioned green block), press the red â™ª switch, and collect 8 notes within 15 seconds. This one is on the tricky side.
...But not yet, obviously, as I have a gem to collect over here first.
There's a gem, which requires the blue gates open. I'll be coming back for it, of course.
Yeah, I figured I'd do that again, since I had the HP for it.

It bothers my OCD a bit that that can happen. Oh, well. It's usually not too big a deal, although it can result in a little bit of time wasted if it resulted in you not breaking the blocks you needed to.
"Click."
Because, once you hit another gate switch up here, you won't be able to access a green gate switch again for the rest of the level.
And there we go. So, that's the second gem, and now the green block can be moved out of the way.
Okay, no real tricks to the last gem. Just gotta get past three bats. In fact, this gem is pretty much a gimme, since you gotta get past these bats anyway.
"Click."

Oh, what was that? Okay, you can normally break two adjacent rows or columns simultaneously, but if you're not perfectly centered between them, you might get pushed fully into one row/column during the tackle like that.
Next, you'll need to maneuver up this way. Don't panic if you need to wait a moment for the spike blocks to move out of the way. You actually do have a decent amount of leeway here.
There we go. I can get the gem now.
Okay, now I need to head down this way to get the second gem. You MUST go for this gem now, before you press any more switches.
And, since I'll be coming back, don't worry about that one coin I left behind there. Now, can I include this enemy in the combo? It's quite risky...

Oh, and the ice bat's shards can destroy these cracked blocks as well, much like the vampire bats in the lava levels earlier, which exploded into fireballs that could also destroy blocks. This'll be important to know in the future.

Now, go down this way, and you'll find a wind switch. Be ready, because when you press it, that large ball below will start rolling to the right, towards the A button, and will only be pressing it for a few seconds.
Now for this part, you see this green block? Do not move it yet. However, do destroy all of the cracked blocks and kill the bat here.
Ow. That's okay, and may have actually helped me.
Okay, new music, new theme, and new elements. First, there's these dash arrows, which let me do this!

So, we're gonna go through this tricky spot again, but with the blue gates open and the rest closed, it changes to become even trickier. Make sure to watch your mana supply. (Using Mira is really helpful.)
Make sure you kill this bunny up here before hitting the yellow switch, or it'll likely get in your way, causing you to become pancaked by the falling blocks.
Let's press this yellow gate switch here, and you probably saw the A gate to the left. That's the way out of the building.
And while I'm doing so, I should try not to crash into spikes.
Each cracked block that's broken is worth 100 points, so let's smash them all! (I'm still not sure how the time bonus is calculated, so I don't know if this is really worth my time, but whatever.)
Brutal combo! (6 kills, 10,500 points)
To do that, break those blocks, then head into the center here.
Very nice. But, I think I could've maybe been one or two tiny iotas faster. What do you guys think?
So, let's take the demonic 6 6-6 votes and head to that level with the twice-voted-for Paintball Maid Mira!
Okay, with that gem in hand, let's continue up this way.
That unlocked 6-B, but... it would cost 10 gems... Hmm...
Killer combo! (15 kills, 52,500 points!)
"Click." (That's what was causing the clicks earlier, BTW.)
Unfortunately, there's a few cracked blocks that aren't lined up properly for tackling. Oh, well. Anyway, dash down here, then up into the bat's room.

Now, that's a nice way to break the ice! So, when you hit these dash arrows, you're propelled forward, and keep going in that direction, until you hit something solid that won't shatter from being tackled.
Alright, now just one gem remains, the one above the exit, and we've gotta find a way to get above the level confines in order to get to it.
D'oh! I accidentally grabbed 1 coin too many. I intended to stop at 91 coins for the 3-star bonus. Oh, well.
Okay, now we get to go through this tricky spot one more time, and with yellow being the open color, it's even trickier.
Okay, ready for some more freeze-tackling fun? Because I sure am!
So, place your votes for either 6-8 (Cold Boom Boom) or 6-B (Zapping Lightning)! And once again, vote for what costumes you want to see as well!
So, hit the wind switch, and go back to the left, towards that tricky spot again. Don't take the route up and right from the wind switch, because it'll take far too long to go that way.
Ow... Yeah, dashing into spikes is kind of painful. (Could be worth doing that here in a Time Attack, though.)
I do currently have 26 gems, so I'd still have 16 to spare after playing that level. But, I'm gonna wait on it and play 6-7 next instead.

Also, there's a wind switch here in case it's not already blowing to the left, which is required to get that gray block out of the way so you can continue. Oh, and you're gonna hear a couple extra clicks here. I'll explain those soon.
Alright, that'll just about do it for this episode... except, there was a vote to get a big combo in 6-5 with Mira, so I'm gonna end off this episode with that. To be continued... Yo!
And, we've got more wind, along with a bunch of color doors, as the level name suggested. So, the first thing that'll happen is the wind will blow the ball above onto the yellow gate switch.
And there you go! A full combo! Now I'll just be finishing the rest of the level here, and that'll be that!
I think I'll go with Ninja Daria this time, since I didn't use that one last time.

And, there's the final gem, so I'm done, and can drop right into the exit! (There was a one-way passage back into the building, but there's no need to use that, as I've already cleaned the place out.)
Now, with the green block unmoved, you can just tackle yourself right into it to quickly grab the last two notes here.
And that unlocked 6-8. (BTW, I don't think it'll involve a cold version of the SMB3 mid-boss.)
Okay, I need to get to the room where that bat is.
Triple combo! (3 kills, 3000 points)
Then, just wait here for the gate to open and fly through it. You could press the blue gate switch if you wanted, although it doesn't really matter at this point.

And, my mouse cursor is hourglassing here. Computer, could you do your random background processes another time, please? (I'm worried an Avira ad will pop up in the lower-right corner now. I'll edit it out if that happens.)
Whoops, needed to be a bit higher to break the blocks that are in my way there.
And, I still need to be higher.
Alright, now let's finish off the last Time Attack level of world 2, with... Pirate Irvette, I guess.
It's pretty obvious that we're gonna be changing the wind direction to get the ball to hit the blue gate switch eventually. So, let's head to the right and combo some enemies.

Now up here, you'd normally want to hit the green switch and then quickly get out of the way of the slime above which will fall on you, but Mira can just gun down the slime early before hitting the switch. Ha.
At this point, I could just clear the level (and you'd want to now during a Time Attack), but I still need that gem. I will at least grab the four coins below the exit now, though.
Note: This was done on my 100% file. Oh, and since there were 2 votes for Paintball Maid Mira, I'll use that costume for the second time today!
A gate up here.
Ahh... the power of cheese...
...Yeah, it releases ice shards in 8 directions. Be sure to dodge them, and be sure you'll have room to dodge them when you slay these guys.

Whew, that was a close call. I was risking running out of mana over the spikes there, but I made it! And, now that I've changed the wind, the ball will open the blue gates for me. Now, I could fly up there to proceed with the level...
